text: Is it possible to get a older version of a intire theme? so lets say I made changes but there is an error and I am not able to fix it can I rollback the intire theme?

Hello :wave:

Is it possible to fetch objects associations when using Search API?

I tried with that query, but it doesn't return associations at all.

```curl --location '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/search>' \
--data '{
    "limit": 100,
    "associations": ["notes","tasks","companies","deals"]
}'```

<@U05V0JNG620> Generally nothing.

We actually update the tech powering HubSpot thousands of times per day, so the CMS you have at 9AM isn’t the same version as at 9PM.

It’s infrequent but when we do need to make <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes>, these get announced on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|developer changelog> at least 90 days in advance, and we do our best to provide guidance if a migration of some kind is needed.

That said for example, sites that I built 8+ years ago on HubSpot (this is before I worked at HubSpot) are still humming around just fine and will be for the forseeable future. It is more likely they will get redesigned/updated by the folks maintaining them now, than as a result of a HubSpot upgrade.
You should check the theme files in the design manager
<@U05UPMU10SE> Is there ever a case where you would rebuild the integration?

assuming it’s the clients property; if the customer is actively asking to have it rebuilt by you (e.g. because they soiled the relationship with their previous partner), or because you can’t maintain it (e.g. because you use a different language or infra or other)
you pushing to rebuilding it will quickly look like a cheap money-grab, which can damage the relationship with the client

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Thank you so much. You've been really helpful

Fairly sure that’s a no, unfortunately.

You can view a full list of recently edited files by going to the design manager -> “view” dropdown at the top on the left hand side of the directory list -> recently edited files.

Sounds like you know how to view prior revisions of specific files. I think that’s the best you’re going to get.
